name: fortinet-fortiddos
label: Fortinet FortiDDoS
description: FortiDDoS Protection Solution defends enterprise data centers against DDoS attacks by leveraging an extensive collection of known DDoS methodologies, creating a multi-layered approach to mitigate attacks.  It also analyzes the behavior of data to detect new attacks, allowing it to stop zero-day threats.

fields.title: Server Address
fields.name: server_address
fields.description: URL of the FortiDDoS appliance to which you will connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.description: Username to access your FortiDDoS appliance to which you will connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Password
fields.name: password
fields.description: Password to access your FortiDDoS appliance to which you will connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.

operations.title: Get Protection Profiles
operations.description: Retrieves the Protection Profiles details from FortiDDoS appliance of the given SPP name.

parameters.title: SPP Name
parameters.name: spp
parameters.tooltip: Name of the service protection profile
parameters.description: Name of the Service protection profile to get setting details.

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: SPP Settings, Service Config, Access Control List, Address Config, Address Config IPv6, Extended Timeout Policy, Thresholds > Thresholds > Scalars, Thresholds > Thresholds > HTTP Methods, Thresholds > Thresholds > Protocols, Thresholds > Thresholds > TCP Ports, Thresholds > Thresholds > UDP Ports, Thresholds > Thresholds > ICMP Types/Codes, Thresholds > Thresholds > URLs, Thresholds > Thresholds > Hosts, Thresholds > Thresholds > Referers, Thresholds > Thresholds > Cookies, Thresholds > Thresholds > User Agents.

operations.title: Update SPP Settings
operations.description: Update (Service Protection Profile) SPP settings based on the inputs provided.

parameters.title: SPP Name
parameters.name: spp
parameters.tooltip: Name of the service protection profile
parameters.description: Name of the Service protection profile to update SPP settings.

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose setting you want to update.
Following are possible resource names: SPP Settings, Service Config, Access Control List, Address Config, Address Config IPv6, Extended Timeout Policy, Thresholds > Thresholds > Scalars, Thresholds > Thresholds > HTTP Methods, Thresholds > Thresholds > Protocols, Thresholds > Thresholds > TCP Ports, Thresholds > Thresholds > UDP Ports, Thresholds > Thresholds > ICMP Types/Codes, Thresholds > Thresholds > URLs, Thresholds > Thresholds > Hosts, Thresholds > Thresholds > Referers, Thresholds > Thresholds > Cookies, Thresholds > Thresholds > User Agents.

parameters.title: Resource Arguments
parameters.name: parameter_name_val
parameters.tooltip: SPP settings arguments in json format
parameters.description: Specify SPP setting arguments in JSON format at the time of update the SPP setting. You can enter the arguments in the following format: {"field1":value1, "field2":value2}. Eg: {"inbound-operating-mode":  "prevention"}

operations.title: Get Global Settings
operations.description: Retrieves settings from the global settings (Global Settings > Settings > Settings) of the FortiDDoS appliance.

operations.title: Get Global Service Protection Profiles
operations.description: Retrieves the global service protection profile (Global Settings > Service Protection Profiles) details from the FortiDDoS appliance.

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: "Switching Policy", "SPP Policy", "SPP Policy Group".

operations.title: Get Settings
operations.description: Retrieves the internal sub resources from settings of the FortiDDoS global settings.

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: HTTP Service Ports, UDP Service Ports, Signaling, Service Provider Address.

operations.title: Get Global Settings Address
operations.description: Retrieves the global setting address of the FortiDDoS appliance.

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: Local Address Config, Local Address Config IPv6, Address Config, Address Config IPv6.

operations.title: Get IP Reputation
operations.description: Retrieves the IP reputation details (Global Settings > IP Reputation) of the FortiDDoS appliance.

operations.title: Get Domain Reputation
operations.description: Retrieves the domain reputation details (Global Settings > Domain Reputation) of the FortiDDoS appliance.

operations.title: Get Proxy IP
operations.description: Retrieves the proxy IP details of the FortiDDoS appliance.

operations.title: Get Proxy IP Policy
operations.description: Retrieves the proxy IP policy details of the FortiDDoS appliance.

operations.title: Get Do Not Track Policy
operations.description: Retrieves the global settings of the FortiDDoS appliance.

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: Do Not Track Policy, Do Not Track Policy IPv6

operations.title: Get Access Control List
operations.description: Retrieves the access control list details of global settings from the FortiDDoS appliance.

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: Access Control List, Access Control List IPv6, Advanced Settings: Distress ACL.

conditional_output_schema.condition: {{this['resource_name'] === 'Access Control List' || this['resource_name'] === 'Access Control List IPv6'}}

operations.title: Get Bypass MAC
operations.description: Retrieves the bypass MAC details of the FortiDDoS appliance.

operations.title: Get System Settings
operations.description: Retrieves the system settings information from FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: Primary Resource Name
parameters.name: primary_resource_name

Network.title: Resource Name
Network.name: resource_name
Network.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: Interface, DNS, Static Route.

Admin.title: Resource Name
Admin.name: resource_name
Admin.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: Admin User, Access Profile, Settings.

Authentication.title: Resource Name
Authentication.name: resource_name
Authentication.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: Auth Radius, Auth LDAP, Auth TACACS+

SNMP.title: Resource Name
SNMP.name: resource_name
SNMP.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: System Information, SNMP Threshold, Community.

parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: Network, High Availability, Admin, Authentication, SNMP, Certificate.

operations.title: Get Log Settings
operations.description: Retrieves log information from the FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the resource whose information you want to retrieve from FortiDDoS.
Following are possible resource names: log_local, log_remote, log_setting_ddos_attack_remote, ddos_global_attack_event_purge, log_setting_snmp_trap_receivers, log_report, ddos_global_attack_report_purge, log_setting_remote_log_settings, alertemail_recipient, alertemail_server, alertemail_setting

operations.title: Get Attack Information
operations.description: Retrieves attack information from FortiDDoS based on the SPP, Direction and Period you have specified.

parameters.title: SPP
parameters.name: spp_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the service protection profile
parameters.description: Name of the Service protection profile to get attack information.

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: Specify direction to retrieves attack information from FortiDDoS. You can choose between: Inbound or Outbound.

parameters.title: Period
parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Specify period to retrieves attack information from FortiDDoS. You can choose between: 1 hour, 8 hours, 1 day, 1 week, 1 month or 1 year.

parameters.title: Subtype
parameters.name: subtype
parameters.description: Specify period to retrieves attack information from FortiDDoS. You can choose between: top_attacks, top_attackers, top_acl_attacks, top_attacked_spps, top_attacked_acl_spps, top_attacked_subnets, top_acl_subnets, top_attacked_destinations, top_attacked_protocols, top_attacked_tcp_ports, top_attacked_udp_ports, top_attacked_icmp_type_codes, top_attacked_http_methods, top_attacked_http_cookies, top_attacked_http_referers, top_attacked_http_user_agents, top_attacked_http_hosts, top_attacked_http_urls, top_attacked_dns_servers, top_attacked_dns_anomalies.

operations.title: Add Distress ACL
operations.description: Add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS based on the parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: MKey
parameters.name: mkey
parameters.description: MKey Name to add a new distress ACL to the FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: ACL Enable
parameters.name: acl-enable
parameters.description: Select ACL enable to add a new Distress ACL into the FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: Destination
parameters.name: destination

ip-netmask-ipv4.title: Destination IPv4 Netmask
ip-netmask-ipv4.name: destination-ipv4-netmask
ip-netmask-ipv4.description: Specify Destination IPv4 Netmask to add a new Distress ACL into the FortiDDoS.

all.title: SPP Name
all.name: spp
all.description: Specify SPP name to add a new Distress ACL into the FortiDDoS.

all.title: Destination IPv4 Netmask
all.name: destination-ipv4-netmask
all.description: Specify Destination IPv4 Netmask to add a new Distress ACL into the FortiDDoS.

parameters.description: Select destination to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. You can choose between: ip-netmask-ipv4, or all.

parameters.title: Destination Port
parameters.name: destination-port

true.title: Destination Port Start
true.name: destination-port-start
true.description: Specify destination port start to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS.

true.title: Destination Port End
true.name: destination-port-end
true.description: Specify destination port end to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS.

false.title: Threshold Per Million
false.name: threshold-per-million
false.description: Specify threshold per million to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. Eg: 1000000

parameters.description: Select this destination port checkbox to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: Destination Port Start, Destination Port End. If you do not select this checkbox specify: Threshold Per Million

parameters.title: DSCP
parameters.name: dscp

true.title: DSCP Value
true.name: dscp-value
true.description: Specify DSCP value to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS.

parameters.description: Select this DSCP checkbox to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: DSCP Value

parameters.title: Fragment
parameters.name: fragment
parameters.description: Select this fragment checkbox to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: Fragment Type

parameters.title: Protocol
parameters.name: protocol

true.title: Protocol Number
true.name: protocol-number
true.description: Specify protocol number to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS.

parameters.description: Select this protocol checkbox to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: Protocol Number.

parameters.title: Source IP
parameters.name: source-ip

true.title: Source IPv4 Netmask
true.name: source-ipv4-netmask
true.description: Specify Source IPv4 Netmask to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS.

parameters.description: Select this source IP checkbox to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: Source IPv4 Netmask.

parameters.title: Source Port
parameters.name: source-port
parameters.description: Select this source port checkbox to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: Source Port Start and Source Port End.

parameters.title: TCP Control Flag
parameters.name: tcp-control-flag

true.title: TCP Control Flag Options
true.name: tcp-control-flag-options
true.description: Specify TCP control flag options to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS.

parameters.description: Select this TCP control flag checkbox to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: TCP Control Flag Options.

parameters.title: TTL
parameters.name: ttl

true.title: TTL Value
true.name: ttl-value
true.description: Specify TTL Value to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS.

parameters.description: Select this TTL checkbox to add a new Distress ACL in FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: TTL Value.

operations.title: Delete Distress ACL
operations.description: Delete Distress ACL based on the name you have provided.

parameters.title: Distress ACL Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the distress ACL.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: The name of the distress ACL which you want to delete.

operations.title: Add Service Protection Profile Policy
operations.description: Adds a new SPP to the FortiDDoS based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Subnet ID
parameters.name: subnet-id
parameters.description: Subnet ID to add a new SPP to the FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: MKey Name
parameters.name: mkey
parameters.description: MKey Name to add a new SPP to the FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: IP Version
parameters.name: ip-version

IPv4.title: IPv4/Netmask
IPv4.name: ip-addr-mask
IPv4.description: IPv4/Netmask to add a new SPP policy to the FortiDDoS.

IPv6.title: IPv6/Prefix
IPv6.name: ipv6-addr-prefix
IPv6.description: IPv6/Prefix to add a new SPP policy to the FortiDDoS.

parameters.description: Select this IP version to add a new SPP policy in FortiDDoS. If you select IPv4 option, then you must specify the following parameter: IPv4/Netmask. If you select IPv6 option, then you must specify the following parameter: IPv6/Prefix.

parameters.title: SPP
parameters.name: spp
parameters.tooltip: Name of the service protection profile
parameters.description: Name of the Service protection profile add a new SPP policy to the FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: Alternate SPP Enable
parameters.name: alt-spp-enable

true.title: Alternate SPP
true.name: alt-spp
true.description: Specify Alternate SPP to add a new SPP policy in FortiDDoS.

true.title: Threshold Per Million
true.name: threshold-per-million
true.description: Specify threshold per million to add a new SPP policy in FortiDDoS.

false.title: Threshold Per Million
false.name: threshold-per-million
false.description: Specify threshold per million to add a new SPP policy in FortiDDoS.

parameters.description: Select this Alternate SPP Enable checkbox to add a new SPP policy to the FortiDDoS. If you select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: Alternate SPP and Threshold Per Million. If you do not select this checkbox, then you must specify the following parameter: Threshold Per Million.

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Specify comment at the time of add a new SPP policy in FortiDDoS.

operations.title: Get Service Protection Profile Policy
operations.description: Get list of Service Protection Profile Policy or specific policy details based on the given policy name.

operations.title: Delete Service Protection Profile Policy
operations.description: Delete Service Protection Profile Policy based on the given policy name

parameters.title: SPP Policy Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the policy which you want to delete.
parameters.name: policy_name

operations.title: Add Legitimate DNS Query
operations.description: Adds a new Legitimate DNS Query to the FortiDDoS based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Specify Query to add a new Legitimate DNS Query into the FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify type to add a new Legitimate DNS Query into the FortiDDoS.

parameters.title: Class
parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Specify class to add a new Legitimate DNS Query into the FortiDDoS.

operations.title: Delete Legitimate DNS Query
operations.description: Deletes legitimate DNS query from a specific from FortiDDoS based on the Domain and Type you have specified.

parameters.title: Domain
parameters.description: Specify domain for which you want to delete legitimate DNS query.
parameters.name: query

parameters.title: Type
parameters.description: Specify type for which you want to delete legitimate DNS query.
parameters.name: type

parameters.title: Class
parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Specify class for which you want to delete legitimate DNS query.

operations.title: Generate BGP Flowspec
operations.description: Generate BGP flow specifications based on the input you have provided.

parameters.title: Vendor
parameters.description: Specify the vendor. The available options are Cisco and Juniper.
parameters.name: vendor

parameters.title: Destination
parameters.description: Specify the destination under attack.
parameters.name: destination

parameters.title: Threshold
parameters.description: Specify the threshold to generate BGP flow specifications.
parameters.name: threshold
